name: Parador de Baiona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We went from Madrid to spend a weekend, with a group of friends. The Parador is an historic building, well preserved and with outstanding views. Prices are reasonable and food is excellent. Staff is very friendly. Rooms are a little old fashioned (something that is typical to Paradores), but well mantained. Not to miss a walk arond the peninsula where the Parador is located, facing the Islas Cies, a fantastic view.
reviews.title: good views at very reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stopped at this hotel for afternoon tea with my family including 7 mth baby . Hotel reception area breathtaking and views from dining area over looking sea . Feels like a castle.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were efficient and food ESP Spanish omelette was tasty .
reviews.title: Exceptional surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had baby changing that was very good .
reviews.title: Most expensive tea bags ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: One night was just not enough in this truly exceptional location. The parador is like a large manor house within ancient castle walls, sited superbly on a promontory looking out to sea. Don't miss walking both around the ramparts (I do like a hotel with its own cannon) which has stunning views of the bay where Columbus's ships sailed in to tell Europe that they had discovered an unknown land across the sea - the Americas! Then walk the lower coastal path beneath the hotel to enjoy a paddle or a sunbathe on the rocky little beaches, or contemplate the crashing Atlantic waves. The parador itself is pleasant, roomy and quite atmospheric. It has a swimming pool with a gated garden, but didnt really enjoy sunbathing there as rather a lot of insects and prefer the pretty little bits of sand, and more local life going on below on the rocks! It is an easy 10 minute walk down to the town and its restaurants and shops. Would definitely return if we can.
reviews.title: Striking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous location with spectacular views across the coast and within easy walking distance of the lovely town of Baiona. Our room was large, clean and well appointed with an amazing view out to sea. Food, service and atmosphere in the dining room were below average, but the bar was much better. We ate in the town (we had an excellent menu del dia in Pazo de Mendoza) and would thoroughly recommend doing that over eating in the hotel. Overall a decent parador and a good base for the rest of the area
reviews.title: Fantastic location but service and food hit and miss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you are going to Baiona, I don't see why you would stay anywhere else. The hotel is perched on a commanding hill above the city, and on the ocean. The ancient walls surround it, but the hotel itself is a modern building. The walls are incredible, with water on three sides. You and your kids can spend a big chunk of time exploring them. The rooms are not spacious, but not tiny either. Opt for an ocean view if you can. The breakfast was fine, but did not measure up to the Parador in Santiago (what could?). We did not eat dinner at the hotel, so I cannot comment.
reviews.title: Big Wow Factor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is worth staying at just for its location, but unless you're prepared to pay a high premium do not expect any view. The inside is very traditional but the rooms were comfortable and the bathrooms both modern and excellent. We chose to go down to Baiona (10-minute walk down - longer back up!) for dinner where there was much more choice and a more appealing atmosphere than the parador's formal dining room with 5-course gourmet meal. Frankly, the staff were less than warm and welcoming but that's probably the only criticism.
reviews.title: Superbly-located old-fashioned parador

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The parador was expensive but we decided to book it anyway as we were going to Galicia for my birthday and wanted to stay somewhere nice. The setting of the parador and its exterior are amazing and beautiful but the interior of the parador is dark and quite drab, the food is expensive and I don't think there was much service apart from the nice woman on reception from Lalin who gave us some good recommendations of day trips. For the price, and for the reputation of the paradors, I think I did expect more. I was also a bit put off when we were walking back up the drive to the parador from the town and the security guard stopped us and didn't seem to believe that we were staying at the parador. Obviously we do not look posh or old enough (as the clientele I would estimate are mostly over 50). I found him quite rude and it was not until I got the room keys out of my bag to show him that he finally let us past. Baiona however is a great town and I will definitely be returning but I doubt it will be to this hotel. At night, there is a great atmosphere with so many people in the bars and restaurants, open air concerts etc. It is also really easy to visit places from Baiona such as the Islas Cies, Tui, el Castro de Santa Trega etc.
reviews.title: Slightly disappointed despite the magnificent setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been staying in Pardors for the last 15 years approx... And I do love the location, the grandeur and heritage of every one we have stayed in but I must say they are staring to get boring sometimes .. And this one, to me, tops the bill in yawn !!I have to agree with the review from The Sussex traveler.. It's time to jaz the place up.
reviews.title: Just wish it could have the same wow factor as the location inside !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Parador has a most beautiful location with 270 degree views. One can walk all round the walls and there is a path at the bottom of the mound. Both are worth the walk. The old town also worth a visit
reviews.title: Superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed on business did not have chance to avail myself of too many facilities though had a quick swim in a slightly cool but clean outdoor pool. There is a restaurant with outdoor seats by the wall which was very good if a bit expensive
reviews.title: Lovely Parador With Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff very friendly
reviews.title: Parador de Baiona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would have given 5 stars but no breakfast before 7:30 and their overnight coffee maker had broken down - the only blemish on an otherwise great visit
reviews.title: Dream location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The parador has a truly lovely setting amongst the old walls and looking out to the Islas Cies (well worth a visit, The Guardian rates a beach there as amongst the 1 best in the world). I found all the staff very helpful and friendly. The breakfasts are superb and weather permitting can be taken on a lovely terrace. Also the bar terrace is a super place to have a drink and watch the sun go down. There are two restaurants at the parador and we prefer the tapas restaurant by the small church. Baiona old town itself is a pleasant little town and offers different options for dining out.
reviews.title: Amazing views - great attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were gladly participating to a wedding in Parador de Baiona in 2010. We found the place amazing! Old times kept in a place that could stand as one of the most beautiful places we have ever been. Incredible facilities, gorgeous gardens and views, incredible location. We have tasted the food and experience a wonderful staying in Baiona!
reviews.title: a castle, a feeling, a wonderful time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I keep coming here over the years (more han 20). The facilities are incredible, very high level and are kept spotless.
reviews.title: A real pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: You sleep in a castle, incredibly located, with 5 star confort and old century feel and old fashioned luxury. Good food, also.
reviews.title: lovely Parador

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A must in this region, if you are willing to pay it.
reviews.title: Pleasant, but suffers from that 'Parador' syndrome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the nicer places I have stayed in Spain/Galicia. Beautiful hilltop setting (it's a parador, duh!) and lovely walks around the area and overlooking the surrounding sea. Tasteful, large, comfortable room.
reviews.title: Stunning location, lovely hotel

description: Within the walled enclosure of Monte Real protected by the sea and flanked by a pine wood, this Parador rises up in a priviledge location. Regal drawing rooms with decorative features from other ages form a distinguished interior in which the spectacular stone staircase of the entrance hall stands out.
